content: [TextBlock(text="[2025 | Age 22] Back in NYC, and the city's energy feels different after Asia. It's like the buildings have grown taller, or maybe I've just shrunk. Got my old health monitor buzzing on my wrist, reminding me I'm back in the concrete jungle where dreams are made of—and heart rates, apparently. Met up with my old friend from NYU; he's now working in blockchain identity. We laughed over how our old college IDs were the peak of our security back then. Now, he's part of a world where your identity is your most valuable asset, and you can't just lose it at a frat party. Life's ironic, isn't it? Here I am, a New Yorker again, but with a touch of wanderlust and a new perspective on the city that never sleeps. Maybe it's time to sleepwalk into the next phase of my life.", type='text')]
